docs.lead_paragraph: A Federal study group formed to assess threats to the ozone shield in the stratosphere has concluded, on the basis of current evidence, that aerosol sprays using fluorocarbons as propellants should be banned by January, 1978.

headline.main: Federal Study Urges Ban On Some Aerosol Sprays; Federal Study Urges Ban On Some Aerosol Sprays

docs.abstract: Fed study group formed to assess threats to ozone shield in stratosphere concludes that aerosol sprays using fluorocarbons as propellants should be banned by Jan '78; evidence reveals that such substances, by depleting ozone that shields the earth from ultraviolet radiation, can substantially increase incidence of skin cancer (M)
docs.snippet: A Federal study group formed to assess threats to the ozone shield in the stratosphere has concluded, on the basis of current evidence, that aerosol sprays using fluorocarbons as propellants should be banned by January, 1978.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Federal study group formed to assess threats to the ozone shield in the stratosphere has concluded, on the basis of current evidence, that aerosol sprays using fluorocarbons as propellants should be banned by January, 1978.

headline.main: Federal Study Urges Ban on Some Aerosol Sprays; Federal Study Urges Ban On Some Aerosol Sprays

docs.abstract: Fed study group formed to assess threats to earth's protective ozone shield by fluorocarbons used in aerosol sprays, urges that those used as propellants in food be regulated by FDA, and that those used in pesticides be regulated by EPA (S)
docs.snippet: A Federal study group formed to assess threats to the ozone shield in the stratosphere has concluded, on the basis of current evidence, that aerosol sprays using fluorocarbons as propellants should be banned by January, 1978.
